intro: Polygala dewevrei var. schmitzii, commonly known as the Schmitz's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Polygalaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish in color, and it produces small, bead-like fruits. This variant is distinguished by its unique morphology and ecological preferences compared to other Polygala species.
